meanings.definition: In a manner related to inertia.
meanings.sent1: The car moved inertially, slowly picking up speed.
meanings.sent2: The ball rolled inertially down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The turtle raced inertially against the hare.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass inertially as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rock sank inertially to the bottom of the lake.

meanings.definition: In a way that is resistant to change or motion.
meanings.sent1: The old door swung inertially on its rusty hinges.
meanings.sent2: The stubborn child sat inertially in the corner, refusing to move.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out inertially, pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked inertially, unwilling to consider new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The gears turned inertially, resisting any attempt to speed up the machine.
